thread.title: In Praise of Curated News Printed on Paper

author: wsjcom
title: In Praise of Curated News Printed on Paper
text:
Regarding Barton Swaim’s “In Praise of the News on Paper” (op-ed, April 16): Like Mr. Swaim, there are certain things that I miss—a handwritten note instead of an email, a call from an old friend instead of a text. But I cannot say that ink on wood pulp is one of them.
The newspaper is costly to print, deliver and recycle, and very difficult to read in a crowded commuter railcar—not to mention the ink stains that seemed to find their way onto almost everything.
...
